info.title: LandedCost Calculation API
info.description:
Landed Cost API providing duty rates, calculation, and item harmonization.
# Basics
### Timestamps
Timestamps should be formatted using ISO-8601 to the nearest second, in UTC e.g `2015-06-12T09:17:37Z`
### Expiries
All Requests will have an associated timestamp. The validity for any request is 1 minute to account for any clock-skew. 
# Authentication
All API requests must be accompanied by an API Access Key. During account provisioning, you will be issued an API Key which you must supply with every request.
## Authorization Header
To pass in the Signature, set the HTTP Authorization Header: 
`authorization: avalaraapikey id:<Your Account Id> key:<Your API Key>`

post.description: Returns the fully qualified landed cost calculation for a shipment.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The document used to request a fully qualified landedcost calculation for a shipment.

post.description: Returns rate information given an HS code, source country and destination country.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The document used to request rate data for a collection of hs codes.

post.description:
Returns units used in all rate formulas for given HS codes.
Can optionally be filtered by providing source and destination country codes.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The document used to request rate units data for a collection of hs codes.

get.description:
Returns the countries we currently support, along with most common classification system for both import and export.
 No request parameters are required for this call. The method returns a full list of supported countries.
Returns a pair of classification (import and export) systems for trade between two countries
get.operationId: Get the System for a Country_

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The two character ISO code for the source country.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The two character ISO code for the destination country.

get.description: Presents all of the available Harmonized Codes as a browesable tree. Each request specifies a parent node, and the response lists all child nodes of that parent. If no parent node is specified, all root-level nodes will be returned.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description:
The classification system you want to browse. Must be one of:
* TARIC
* SCHEDULEB
* HTS

parameters.name: parent
parameters.description: The name of the parent node. Note that it is important to use the name of the node, as not all nodes have a harmonized code, and the code itself is different than the name.

get.description: Search for Duty Rates for a harmonized code. Rates are dependant on at least a destination country.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: The classification system to which the code belongs

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: The destination country for which rate data is desired

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: An optional filter for rates that limits results to a specific origin country

get.description: Allows for the traversal of classification system, harmonized codes, and duty rates, allowing the user to browse the available content.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: The classification system. If omitted, the response will be all current classification systems

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The harmonized code within a system. If code is provided, system must also be provided

parameters.name: fullpath
parameters.description: If present, the response will include the entire chapter, subchapter, etc. and description data for a code

incoterms.description: Terms of sale. Used to determine buyer obligations.

entityType.description: Type of sale. Can be used to determine applicable tax types.

mode.description: Shipping method.  Can be used to determine applicable tax types

express.description: Is Shipping method.  Can be used to determine applicable tax types

landedCost.description: Calculated landedCost.  Total of all products and applicable taxes and fees.

buyer.description: Obligations the buyer is responsible for paying.

region.description: Source region of the shipment, in <//TODO FIND ISO FORMAT> format.
Destination region of the shipment, in <//TODO FIND ISO FORMAT> format.

SourceCountryList.description: Source country of the shipment, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

DestinationCountryList.description: Destination country of the shipment, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

hsCode.description: The harmonized classification code of the product.

extendedPrice.description: Extended price (price * quantity) of the item shipped.

units.description: Collection of units of measure used to calculate applicable taxes and fees

name.description: Name of the unit of measure.

amount.description: Value associated with this unit of measure.

total.description: Total value associated with this unit of measure (amount * quantity).

items.example: Shipment meets US import duty de minimis threshold. Therefore, import duty applies.

name.description: Other calculated tax or fee name.

amount.description: Other calculated tax or fee amount.

hsCode.description: The harmonized classification code of the product

source.description: The source country used to determine system and further filter the rate response

destination.description: The destination country used to determine system and further filter the rate response

rate.description: The rate as written in the source material

taxSection.description: The tax section the rate applies to

name.description: The unit of measure of the rate formula

hsCode.description: The harmonized classification code of the product

source.description: The source country used to determine system and further filter the rate response

destination.description: The destination country used to determine system and further filter the rate response

hsCode.description: The harmonized classification code of the product.

source.description: The source country used to determine system and further filter the rate response

destination.description: The destination country used to determine system and further filter the rate response

hsCode.description: The harmonized classification code of the product.

source.description: The source country used to determine system and further filter the rate response

GetSystemForCountryResponse.title: Get the System for a Country response

export.description: The system of export classification between the source and destination countries specified
export.title: Export

system.description:
The classification system. Must be one of:
* TARIC
* SCHEDULEB
* HTS

import.description: The system of import classification between the source and destination countries specified
import.title: Import

system.description:
The classification system. Must be one of:
* TARIC
* SCHEDULEB
* HTS

description.example: Military weapons, other than revolvers, pistols and the arms of heading 9307
description.description: The human-readable description of the classification

name.description: The name of the node; this can be used to find the child nodes

description.example: ARMS AND AMMUNITION; PARTS AND ACCESSORIES THEREOF

name.description: A concatenation of the system and harmonized code: `<system>_<harmonizedCode>`

sourceCountry.description: The two-character ISO code identifying the origin country associated with the duty

formula.description: The formula used to calculate the rate, presented in Avalara-specific format

type.description:
There are three types of landed cost rates that may be returned.
 * ad valorem: this rate applies to the declared `customs-value` This is typically represented as a percentage of the cost.
 * units: this is a rate that is tied to unit of meaure. This is typically expressed as a monetary value per quantity, such as: $1/kg
 * unknown: there is no stored rate data (or no applicable taxes) for the specified combination. Note that these will always have `"formula": "notax()"

unit.description: If the rate is assessed at a unit level, the appropriate unit involved. If `type` is not `units`, this value will be an empty string.

raw.description: The human-readable version of the rate.

currency.description: The three-character ISO code for the currency in which the duty should be assessed.

items.description: The required input values to calculate the correct duty amount.

customsValue.description:
The customs value describes how to apply the duty rate. There are two current types
 * fob
 * cif

GetRateDataResponse.title: Get Rate Data response
GetRateDataResponse.description: Array of rate information by source country, formatted as for retrieval for Duty Rate retrieval

name.description: A concatenation of the system and harmonized code: `<system>_<harmonizedCode>`

description.description: A description of the harmonized code classification
description.example: Hand-hooked, that is, in which the tufts were inserted by hand or by means of a hand tool
